snippet: The former deputy director of the C.I.A. said he was not pressured to edit the widely debunked talking points on the 2012 Benghazi attack in an effort to protect President Obama and former Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton.
abstract: Mike Morell, former Central Intelligence Agency deputy director, testifies before House Intelligence Committee that he was not pressured to edit the widely discredited talking points on the 2012 Benghazi, Libya, attack in effort to protest Pres Obama and former Sec of State Hillary Rodham Clinton.
lead_paragraph: The former deputy director of the C.I.A. said he was not pressured to edit the widely debunked talking points on the 2012 Benghazi attack in an effort to protect President Obama and former Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton.

headline.main: Ex-C.I.A. Official Defends Actions After Benghazi Strike
